name: unassuaged
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of a feeling) not made less strong or easier to bear: After half an hour she left, her curiosity unassuaged. Maybe there's an element of unassuaged guilt in his actions.
More examplesFewer examplesThe grief and anger of his family is entirely understandable, and as I have been powerfully reminded - remains unassuaged.The public's hunger for the most banal facts about celebrities remains unassuaged.Either her aunt has a fanbase of millions, or there is an unassuaged world appetite for Irish cuisine.
